      • scale

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage scale(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi,
                                 double scale)
        Scale provided BufferedImage by the provided factor. A scaling factor value should be greater than 0 and less than 2. Note that scaling will impact performance and image quality.
        Parameters:
        bi - BufferedImage to be scaled.
        scale - positive scaling factor
        Returns:
        scaled instance of provided BufferedImage

      • scale

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage scale(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi,
                                 int w,
                                 int h)
        Scale provided BufferedImage to the specified width and height dimensions. If a provided dimension is 0, the aspect ratio is used to calculate a value. Also, if either contains -1, the positive value will be used as for the long side.
        Parameters:
        bi - BufferedImage to be scaled.
        w - width the image is to be scaled to.
        h - height the image is to be scaled to.
        Returns:
        scaled instance of provided BufferedImage

      • clipRegion

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage clipRegion(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi,
                                      double x,
                                      double y,
                                      double w,
                                      double h)
        Scale provided BufferedImage to the specified width and height dimensions. If a provided dimension is 0, the aspect ratio is used to calculate a value. Also, if either contains -1, the positive value will be used as for the long side.
        Parameters:
        bi - BufferedImage to be scaled.
        x,y,w,h - proportion
        Returns:
        clipped instance of provided BufferedImage

      • checkIfJp2

        public static final boolean checkIfJp2(java.io.InputStream in)

        Parameters:
        in - InputStream of possible JP2 codestream
        Returns:
        true is JP2 compatible format
